title: pastpens
author: pastpens
content: Vintage Waterman Silver Ray Ink-vue Fountain Pen– Ink-vue filler– “ideal” globe emblem on barrel endUp here is a vintage Waterman’s IDEAL Silver-Ray INK VUE fountain pen, which was manufactured in USA circa 1930s.https://pastpens.com/shop/vintage-waterman-silver-ray-ink-vue-emblem-pen/This Waterman’s is a fine example, in eye-catching gorgeous rare silver black striped marble, and semi-transparent amber striped barrel. You can see thru the amber semi-transparent barrel under the light clearly, and you will not be disappointed.The chrome plated pocket clip, cap band and side lever is in parallel lines art-deco patterning.The pen is in nice condition. It bears a large Waterman’s Account 14ct solid gold nib, with nice keyhole airhole.The imprint on the barrel is crisp.A new ink-vue sac has been fitted. The filling system is in good working order.The pen has been restored and tested for full functionality. Only there are some minor wears on the body due to agePlease also refer to our other Waterman’s fountain pen collection.
